bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George A. Kellogg, February 3, 1942

div1.p: Hench reports that he enjoyed Emilie Reed's birthday party. He visited Lazear's boyhood home, where he saw old photographs, books, and letters.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to George A. Kellogg, February 3, 1942
div1.opener:
February 3, 1942
Mr. George A. Kellogg
257 Cornelison Avenue
Jersey City, N. J.
My dear Mr. Kellogg:
div1.p:
I am just recovering from my Washington trip. We had a grand
time. Mary and I were the only outsiders at Mrs. Walter Reed's eighty-sixth
birthday party. A relative of Dr. Lazear's took me to his old boyhood home
near Baltimore, in the attic of which I found old photographs and old books
of his, and one hundred forty letters of his to his mother, many from Cuba.
What a find!

Now to answer your three letters. Thanks greatly for Mrs.
Ames' address. I shall write to her. Gust Lambert in Chicago gave me Ames'
photograph. Sorry we didn't have it sooner.

Thank you for the note regarding my visit to the Agramonte
Library. They must have been hard up for news to put that in. The clippings
and reproductions you sent all interested me greatly. I am sharing the colored
A.M.A. inserts with General Truby and others.

Have you heard any more about Hoffman? Nobody has verified to
me his connection with the Finlay Institute. He is certainly not director,
as you addressed him in your letter of January 20.

Thanks especially for the small colored prints of the Cuban
versions. Shortly I will write to the man who wants me to write that up.

Yes, I met Cornwell in the photographic library of the Surgeon
General's office. I was surprised and delighted to see him. I had a lousy
cold and no wonder I looked tired.

Nuts to those who beat us on my idea of a good theatrical review.
They are certainly using our idea but their price is rediculous. I still think
the same thing could be done at 25¢ a copy. Apparently what they are putting
out is a very “arty” magazine for lovers of the “Thurtr”!
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
